task_summary: Perceive the T-shaped block and the circular goal, approach and make gentle contact, align yaw, then execute one long and one fine push to place the block inside the goal circle before retreating.

task_long_description.overview: A fixed-base manipulator with a circular end-effector must push a T-shaped block across a planar workspace into a marked circular goal region. The behavior emphasizes reliable perception, gentle contact establishment, yaw alignment of the tool, and staged pushing to control rotation of the T-piece. Visual evidence shows a red T block, a drawn circle goal on the tabletop, and a cylindrical tool approaching from above. The plan uses fallback perception, precise alignment, a primary push to traverse most of the distance, a secondary corrective push for fine placement, and a safe retreat once the goal is achieved.
preconditions: Workspace is clear except for the T block and goal mark
Camera view of the table is unobstructed
Robot is homed and above the workspace
Control and observation run near 10 Hz
stepwise_plan: Detect or scan for the T block and the goal
Move above the block and align laterally with tight tolerance
Lower until first contact is detected at low speed and force threshold
Set yaw to align push direction
Execute a long push toward the goal
Re-align to the goal if needed and perform a short corrective push
Retreat and wait briefly to stabilize
success_criteria: Block’s footprint overlaps the goal circle within a small tolerance
Block remains stationary after final push for a short dwell
Tool is clear of the object and goal area
failure_and_recovery: If perception fails, rescan with raster/spiral patterns
If contact is missed, re-approach and lower again
If object rotates or overshoots, re-align yaw and apply a shorter corrective push
If occluded, retreat slightly and retry perception
task_long_description.termination: End when the block is inside the goal circle and the tool has retreated, or when retries/timeouts are exhausted.

frame_3.now_evidence: first stable contact and alignment cue visible
frame_3.predicts_next: push actuation expected; confirms goal direction

task_instruction: The task requires pushing a T-shaped block (gray) to a fixed target (green) with a circular end-effector (blue). Both observation and control frequencies are 10Hz.

node_specs.description: Checks if the T block is in view before acting.
Raster scan to localize the T block if not visible.
Checks if the circular goal is in view.
Spiral scan to locate the goal if not visible.
Moves to a safe height above the T block.
Lateral approach with tight alignment to prepare for contact.
Descend slowly until light contact is detected.
Align end-effector yaw with push direction.
Re-align relative to the goal region for fine placement.
Short corrective push to finish placement.
Back away to avoid disturbing the placed block.

failure_modes: Object not detected due to glare or occlusion
Tool yaw misaligned causing T-block rotation
Contact not sensed leading to missed push
recovery_strategy: Re-align yaw and re-approach with tighter tolerance
Replace long push with two shorter pushes
Retreat and reattempt contact if not detected
Re-detect goal and adjust approach vector
assumptions: Frames show a red T block and a blue goal mark; instruction color mentions gray block and green target, so visual evidence is prioritized
Push direction assumed 90° in table frame based on apparent goal alignment
10 Hz rates imply modest timeouts; discrete timeout bins used
No grasp is performed; task is pure pushing

expected_success_criteria: Block footprint overlaps the goal circle and remains still after dwell
No collisions with table boundaries or camera stand
